intro: Ixora attenuata, commonly known as the slender flame bush, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, clustered red flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Ixora attenuata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various garden settings.
